Yes.  I made the choice that was right for me.  And I don't regret it.  But even for me there were days when I felt so lost so invis- ible.  And then I'd hate myself for the kids not being enough.
It's the same choice you made.
Juggle it!  Move the darkroom into your house.  You've got that room downstairs with the treadmill Luke never uses anyway.  Don't lose your confidence.  Don't lose your edge.
Hey you haven't quit on you I'm sure as hell not gonna.  I just mean I'm juggling a lot right n...
You mean after I'm dead?
It was just a job there'll be plenty of others.
Do what you've worked your whole life to do?
It's just not the right time t...
No.
I'm thinking.  Do I know you well enough to really chew you out?
...go to the park.  In the worst way.
Hon maybe your mom would like t...
It's <u>covered</u> okay?  I appreciate your concern.  Can I talk to her?
Yah?  Well even the best mom in the world the smartest the wisest whatever.  Needs to know when to find a Plan B.  Cos Plan A <u>is</u> not and <u>will</u> n...
Thanks but it's under control.
Can I say one thing?  I mean the <u>last</u> thing I want to do is inter- fere on the Brad thing b...
How's she doing with Brad?
Yeh she's...I'll get you Ben first it's past his bedti...
Eat your heart out.  Is Annabelle there?
What else?  Keep on keepin' on.
And you said...
He's relentless.  A <u>major</u> asshole.
I think my 'primo shit' got left in my 'bellbottoms.'
The primo stuff is great for pain.
Brad Kovitsky.
You try to center on the big issues y'know.  What it's all about.  What this whole trip has meant.  But then the <u>really</u> big issues keep swamping y...
Yeh that's bull.  I'm going for serene they say some actually get there.
You look sick.  But you look... together.  Mentally tough.
I really look like shit.
It's promising this one.  We're upbeat.
So.  Hopeful.
It's a mess right now.  That's my project when I get back.
Can I look at the pictures?
Beats me.  Ask your mom.
And you said...?
Doesn't <u>begin</u> to describe it. I mean you've got cancer <u>this</u> is serious.
She's devastated.

Right.  Which is the whole <u>point</u> of this 'going out' thing so one of them can dump the other one and they can imitate the whole passionate adult soap opera tragedy without ever having to actually date.
Oh my God.
Anyway.  He walks up to her on lunch yard today.  And tells her... publicly...that they're 'breaking up.'
...going out yeh.  I had kids of my own once.

As you may know 'going out' in the six grade doesn't mean shit.  They don't actually <u>go</u> to a movie or anywhere they don't even eat lunch together it's just a declaration to the world that they're...
Toi.  They've been 'going out' for two weeks.
Moi?
She was afraid you'd make a big deal out of it.
She hasn't mentioned this.
That.  And.  Annabelle is over her head.  With Brad 'The Dreamboat' Kovitsky.
You're a cross-dresser.
So I have to tell you something in confidence...
Luke's depo ran late.  I promised I'd take notes.
Small world.
Ironic huh?
Okay I'm undeserving.
I have given them more<u>love</u> and more <u>care</u> every fifteen <u>minutes</u> of their lives than you could manage in the next fifty <u>years</u>!
See I know that.
They came out of my <u>body</u>!
You are <u>marrying</u> the <u>greatest</u> guy who walks this <u>earth</u>.  Who I have <u>loved</u> from my <u>heart</u> for twelve<u>years</u>!
And cigarettes.  I smoke too.
How would you know <u>anything</u>?
I don't but...
How the hell would you know?
You bet you are.
You're not dying.
Life's a trade-off.  You get cancer your hair falls out but you <u>do</u> get to smoke dope.
Really.  By what right?  Six months of part-time screw-ups?
I got used to...thinking of them. As...my kids too.
...it's my problem too.
Then let him talks to me.  We don't need you to solve our prob...
Luke.  Can't live like that.
Did I hear the word...
We can't live like that.
Bi-coastal parenting.  Happens every day.  Luke gets the kids every other summer every other holiday it's not ideal but people make it work and...
But I came here to...
Nobody likes a snoop.
And I know checking into your life was inexcusable...
Don't flatter yourself.
Look you've never liked me...
You're taking the kids.  And moving to San Francisco.
You WHAT?
You're not working at Random House I talked to them.
My boss.
I was looking for Annabelle's book and I found your tickets.  And the note.  From your new boss.
I don't know wh...
Let's...hold up for a bit.  It may not happen.  Our secret okay?
Uh.  Have you told Luke and the ki...
Hey any help you need we'll cover.
...make some trips into the city. Sometimes overnight.
Wowie.  How wonderful!
...thinking of going back to Random House.  On a part-time basis.
Not great.  Plus I've got things on my mind.  You know.
You feeling all right?
When I twisted hair like this it means I'm intimidated by you...
Yes?
Jackie?
She was angry at herself.
Last week when she chopped her Barbie's bangs all to hell --
Anxiety.
What about obsessively picking her split ends?
No way.  I told her two three years maybe for such an expens...
Hey.  At least it's not an editing machine.
I'm sorry I just...
It's okay it's twenty minutes.  The horse'll be there.
Sorry I'm late I got lost dropping Ben off at Kevin's.
Do you have a word limit you need to hit every day or can I finish?
Not personally.
Ben likes to be read to.  Do you know Dr. Seuss...?
Why not just bring the whole toilet?
Bandaids for cuts.  Bandaids for new shoe blisters.  Packet of Wash n Dri's. Kleenex.  Sugar free lollipops potty seat covers for public restrooms...
Fine forget it.
I'm already on thin ice.  Yesterday I actually thought my boss was going to fire me.
However many.  It's not enough.
What?  And have Federal agents jump out of the bushes with court orders? How many years do you get in this state for giving second-rate care to minors?
I have an appointment this after- noon.  I need someone to take them to the park.
I did it for her.
So why did y...
Those are <u>my</u> children you're practicing on.  They deserve <u>first-</u> rate care.  Every minute.  Of every night.  And every day.
I need practice.
You're not terribly good at taking care of h...
She already hates me.  You've seen to that.
I didn't do it for you.  Believe me.
I didn't need you to take the blame for me I'm quite...
I have a snoop.
I don't recall inviting you.
I'm sorry.  Look I'm not real comfortable being here but...
A court <u>order</u> is gonna say that <u>woman</u> is <u>never</u> <u>alone</u> with my children!  Ever <u>again</u>!  Do you HEAR that?
Well maybe they would if they thought it was okay with y...
I am not <u>here</u> to make it easier for you.  These are <u>my</u> children.  They don't want to <u>be</u> with you.
You listen carefully because I am only going to say this once.  That woman has nothing more to do with my children.
Jackie if I thought for one moment...
I'm sorry I didn't mean to break your concentration.  I thought it would be a nice moment to rememb...
Annabelle doesn't really want to talk to you right now.
Think twice.  Before you <u>ever</u> pull that again.
Yeh?
Of all the <u>cheap</u> excuses.  To break a child's heart.
Look I...
Machines do not EAT message.
You got to hell!
But it's not on the schedule!
Get out!
Maybe the problem is your <u>kids</u>.  Maybe they're spoiled coddled <u>brats</u>!
Oh and I don't because I have a children?! The problem is you're too self-involved to ever be a mother.

You're damn right.  I'm gonna sick of your imperious bullshit.  I never said I was Betty Fucking Crocker.  If every time life hits her in the face you want to have a 12 hour talk every third Friday or the month -- go ahead!  I have a life!

You mean for you.  A 10-year-old girl is coping with the fact that her father is never coming back to live with his family.  She sees her father naked with another woman for the first time. And you think it's best for her if every- one pretends it didn't happen?  This isn't going to work out.
No.  I thought it might be uncomfortable for her --
Did you or Luke talk to her about it afterwards?
I was in there in him.
I'm sure that didn't upset her. Everyone in our family takes showers.
Luke was in the shower this morning and Annabelle sort of walked in without knocking.
<u>Forgiveness?</u>  For <u>what</u> exactly?

...a ridiculously <u>expensive</u> and <u>inappropriate</u> item which her father and I have already <u>told</u> her she is <u>far</u> too young to own.  But <u>you</u> apparently want to <u>buy</u> her forgiveness with...
She's been talking about this little editing machine it's only...
Nothing.  Look I want to talk to you about...well...Luke said to ask you...
What did you do?
Maybe you could back off just a little bit --
What happened with Annabelle?  Has nothing I said gotten through to you?
Annabelle how's your video rep...
What is this?  The Betty Ford Center?
We don't have any coffee.
Can I please have a cup of coffee?
Every Tuesday except the 3rd Tuesday of the month when it's switched to Friday except in April when she rides on Thursday.  It's not that hard.  Didn't you have a mother?
This is Friday her riding lesson is on Tuesdays.  I got it right here...
How do you hold down a job?  It's 8:10. You were supposed to be here at 7:00. She's missed her sunrise Groom'n Ride.
I'm gonna get me a drink.
Where you goin'?
How about the promises we make to our kids?  About <u>their</u> future.  Do we shrug those off just that easily?
We make our lives one step at a time.  We do the best we can.  The truth about the future?  A promise. Is only a hope.
Because you've changed so much.
That's not us.
'But keep dancing and if you're lucky I might just never leave who knows?'
No here's ugly.  'I love <u>you</u> babe. It's just our <u>life</u> together I'm not so sure about...'
That's a pretty ugly thing you just said.
No she threw you out.  What a difficult woman.
'...I don't know if I can make it.' That's what I said.  But I didn't leave.

Excuse me.  'Things are so confusing for me Jack.  Our life feels too comfortable too safe too predict- able.  It's a partnership it's juggling schedules.  When I think of playing that out every day for the rest of my life...'
Restless.
By way of saying you were unhappy.
I told her I loved her.
Let me put it this way.  Hell no.
Can we go sit somewhere?
What do you call it?  You told her you had doubts.
She called it a fight.  <u>The</u> fight.

'...the kids have camp.  Their friends are here.  Over there I'll just be shopping in a language I don't even know.  My life and the kids' lives aren't here to service your mid-life crisis.'  Did it go like that?
...while she watched the kids.  Then you booked this flat in Paris for your family's summer.  But she said...
I needed some time away.
You took a fishing trip with the boys. Liked it so much you took another.
Why in the world would she t...
Imagine my relief.  So what's for dinner?
Well they will be.
Just like to make sure.  That your past.  And my future.  Are real different.
Hold your applause.  We're not having fun here.
What a great surpri...
I made that paella you liked. It's on the stove.
No problem.
I know that.
She's not gonna die.
Great wallow in guilt you <u>sure</u> you're not Jewish?
They're my kids.
Are you hungry?  You could make us something?
It's Anna Sui you should be doing it.
It's just an assignment.
It's no biggie.
Well I think you should tell him you changed your mi...
What's eight ten years?  Hell you'll still be ambulatory.  I think.
Rache it may take time.
Everything's gonna work out.  The kids and I...we're going to love each other.
Because I can't hurt anyone like this ever again.
Okay...Is that the good thing or the bad thing?
It's forever you know.
I think so too...
I think so...What do you think?
Oh my God.  Are you serious?
You haven't done <u>one</u> goddam thing to make any of this easier...
Rache get out of th...
Why are you taking this out on <u>him</u>?
Our weekend.  At that sweet little B & B.
And it's <u>my</u> call.  I promised them water-skiing instead o...
We have the kids.  Next weekend.
Hey I sold my body to Satan to clear Friday at two o'clo...
Not yet.
Uh.  Annabelle's video report has been switched again.
Get ready.  To get <u>really</u> mad.

You know I don't need another person in this family making me feel like an idiot...your ex-wife's doing a bang up job and I have to face it every Tuesday and Thursday and every other goddamn weekend and I just don't know how the hell you were married to her for so goddamn long!  Jesus what did you see in her?  I don't get it -- I just don't get it.
No you don't.  And I'm not gonna screw with my kids heads right now --
Oh right...So it's just complicated for you and Jackie -- for me it's pretty simple cause I just don't understand...
It's complicated for Jackie.  It's complicated for me...You don't have kids -- you don't understand --
Really?  Look in your ex-wife's eyes.
Nobody's telling them to hate you --
And what you're telling them is keep hating her -- keep up the good work --
They don't hate you --
Look.  I know they hate me.
I know how responsible caring adults parent children.  I'm bribe 'em.  But 'em a dog or something.  Maybe a Doberman.
But you're not good at this.  Not yet. I'm sorry.
But?  But what?
I trust you of course I do but --
You don't trust me to be alone with them.
Can't handle them myself is what you mean.  Can't.
You don't need to.  I don't expect you to handle them yourself.
I can take them to work with me -- I can shift things around --
Just a babysitter -- I mean...you're working...
For what?
Anyway I thought...while I'm gone...maybe I'll hire in some help.
Jesus.
We have the kids this weekend so...
So I'll have to order in?
I just found out I have to go to Boston to get a deposition.  I might not be back until Saturday.
Yeh it's cheaper.
You'd rather spoil our walk home.
I didn't want to spoil our supper...
Uh-oh.  I mention marriage all of a sudden...  Ve <u>haff</u> to ta...
We have to talk.
The way you cook.  If you could make love I'd marry you.
Well it wasn't a reduction like you do it!  Boiling down half a ton of bones...
It was a veal stock I thi...
Okay if they're going to <u>have</u> a sauce put something <u>in</u> it besides flour and chicken broth...
Something came up.  C'mon Ben! I've got a shoot at three...
No.  I'm doing it behind her back.
Hi I'm here to pick up Ben.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Oh yes that's right.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Goodbye Mister Ambassador.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Don't you realize that despite your incredible distrust and suspicion that in fact you place a far greater trust in us than inspection would require?  You trust us not to cause a war accidentally - and of course we are obliged to place the same trust in you.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Surely you don't expect us to destroy our weapons without being able to verify that you are doing the same?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: That's nonsense and you know it!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: This dreadful accident could never have happened if your government hadn't cynically and hypocritic- ally blocked every proposal we made for disarmament or arms control!!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: How dare you talk to me in this manner?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Damn you de Sade!  You know as well as I do that this was the act of a mentally sick man - a single individual whose crack-up can probably be traced to the strains and tensions caused by your country.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yes?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: The report is entirely untrue.  I can assure you of that.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: That's preposterous!  We have no such program!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Mister Ambassador what on earth possessed your country to build this weapon?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Where is this...thing?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I'll hold this if you don't mind.  You can have it back when you leave.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: What's the meaning of this?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Did you get that Kulnick?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: At his office in the Capitol.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yes of course.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Don't be ridiculous.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Now Mister Ambassador.  In a very few moments we should have Premier Belch on the phone.  I intend to tell him exactly what has happened.  I merely want you to authenticate certain facts for him.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Moffo!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Certainly - how about some breakfast?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Please be calm Ambassador De Sade.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Who the hell do you think you are sir???

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: It might still be worth trying Riki-Tiki- Tavi.  R...T...T...There's only three combinations of -- T...T...R or T...R...T...

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: The three-letter code group.  Or maybe some combination of the three letters. P...O...E or P...E...O or E...O...P... let's see there would be six possible combinations.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I think that just might be it!  Although it could be Riki-Tiki-Tavi.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Come in...come in... Peace On Earth... Peace On Earth...yes...

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Colonel remember a reprimand from the President can be pretty serious to a career officer...Just a second operator I know I have it somewhere.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Operator...How much would the call be station-to-station?...Thirty-five cents cheaper?...I'd still be short twenty cents ...Just a second operator...  Colonel shoot the lock off the Coke machine.  There's bound to be enough change in there.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well I'm General Ripper's Executive officer. He'll want to talk to me.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: He wanted to talk to General Ripper didn't he?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Wait a minute.  The President!!  That's it! The President!!!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Okay Colonel.  But look there's a pay phone just outside in the hall.  Maybe that works huh?  Maybe it'll work?  What do you think?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Look Colonel.  Maybe it's too late. Maybe they've sent Air Command in already.  But we've got to try to con- tact somebody.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Now look I'm picking up this ordinary telephone.  See?...Hello?...Hello?... Nuts the lines must still be disconnected.  The General had us disconnect...

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Sure...sure Colonel.  Now look I'm picking up the phone...nice and slow.  Right?...Hello? ...Hello?  Hello?...Hello?...Gee it must be edad. Probably the lines were hit during the fighting.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Look Colonel.  You keep me covered but let me just pick up this red telephone that connects to Air Command headquarters. Okay?...I won't play any tricks on you... Okay?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Didn't they tell you?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Look General Ripper went off his rocker and ordered the 843rd Bomb Wing to attack with H-bombs.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Colonel don't you know what's going on?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Look Colonel.  I've got to talk to somebody at Air Command.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Look I didn't shoot him!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: What?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well you can't do that because he's dead.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I'm afraid I'll have to ask you to take the film out.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Buck when I told you to give them right up to the top you said we couldn't insult a general officer by asking him to pass a test to see if he's a psycho.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Damn it!  Damn it!  I've been telling you all for years you've got too damned many psychoes in the service.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: You aren't sure!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: May I be stupid enough to inquire WHY IN HELL THE BASE COMMANDER OF THE 843d BOMB WING DID A THING LIKE THAT ???

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: General Schmuck?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: What kind of trouble?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I want him upped to Brigadier General and recomended for the D.S.C.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: What do you suppose is going to happen if General Ripper's planes start bombing their targets?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: You see you knew the answer all the time General.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Under the circumstances General what would you think they should do?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: That's a very wise deduction General.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I am aware of what a condition red alert implies.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yes?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yes sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Thank you sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: No sir.  I'm just bringing the facts to your attention sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: General Ripper if I shut down the communi- cations center there'll be no radio or teleprinter contact with Air Command head- quarters or anyone for that matter.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: No sir.  Plan-R to be radioed to the Wing.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Plan-R????

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: No sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: To you sir.  But how do I know?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yes sir.  I just thought of something sir.  How do I know I'm talking to you now?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I understand sir.  Nothing comes or goes without your personal say-so.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: You're right sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: That's right sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yes sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: But...what kind of a shooting war?  Have they hit any of our cities yet?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: A shooting war!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yes sir.  What's up General Ripper?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Condition Red!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yes sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: No sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I don't know sir. We just spoke a few minutes ago.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Certainly General.  Why do you ask sir?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yes sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Combat Operations Center Major Mandrake speaking.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Major I happen to believe in a life after this one so I believe I will have to answer for what I have done.  I think I can.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: General now that you've done that I beg you to recall the Wing.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Peace on earth.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: To peace on earth Major.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yes sir.  Why don't you stop the fighting sir?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Major those are my boys out there dying.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Major I hate to say this but I think you've been enemy indoctrinated and you don't even know it.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Look sir.  I'm no expert on the subject but I've read some pretty sharp ideas the big boys have.  Like say both countries agreeing to a million dollar reward and international protection for anyone who gives evidence of cheating to the inspectors. You can't hide those things without a lot of people knowing about it.  And if I were going to try and hide a few I wouldn't want to depend on the fact that some poor slob isn't going to run and blab for a million bucks.  We're as smart as they are and if they cheat or even hold back information we'd pull right out.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Do you think they would cheat?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: No sir.  I'm sure we wouldn't.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Do you think we'd cheat?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: General what's good enough for the President and all the experts he's got working on the thing is good enough for me.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: And you'd like to see that?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: If they gave us what we think we need yes I guess we would.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: But if they suddenly opened up and gave us the inspection we want we'd agree wouldn't we?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: But General we're on our toes.  We haven't agreed to anything for years.  Inffact a a lot of people say we never will.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I'll tell you what I do think.  If they say they're for disarmament I say anyone who says they're for disarmament is either a traitor or a damned fool.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Don't you think he knows something about this General Ripper?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Don't be offended Major.  Our President holds the same views.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well I'm not sir.  Honestly sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Major you're talking like one of them!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Gee sir that last remark doesn't exactly make all the sense in the world.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: No Major I don't.  They have no regard for human life.  They wouldn't care if they lost their whole country as long as they won.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well for the same reasons we do sir. Don't you see?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I still ask why do they want disarmament?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well sir I remember an example that pointed out that if a system was safe on 99.99% of the days of the year given average luck it would fail in thirty years.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Go on Major.  You fascinate me.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: That's right sir.  And don't forget in a few years a lot of other countries will have the bomb.  What if they start something?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I was just going to say as long as the weapons exist sooner or later something's going to happen -- and that'll be it for both countries.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Go on Major.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well sir like I said for the same reasons we do.  I mean all the experts say the most likely way for War to start nowadays is by an accident or a mistake or by some mentally unbalanced person --

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Then don't you realize the Bomb gives us Peace not War?  And if that's the case I ask you again: Why do they want disarmament?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Right.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: But war doesn't make sense precisely because the weapons can kill an entire country -- right?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I don't know sir.  But they're just as anxious to avoid a nuclear war as we are. War just doesn't make sense any more for anybody.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: But we mean it because we are a peace- loving country.  Are they a peace-loving country Major.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yes sir.  But so do we.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: You're very naive Major.  Don't they say they want disarmament?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: And I guess they won't until they agree to let us inspect inside their country.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Not yet Major.  Not yet.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well I know they've been going on for years and they haven't gotten any place.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Where?  Everywhere Major.  Everywhere.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Where sir?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Major Mandrake I guess you don't follow what's going on too closely do you?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: But if you just let things alone we wouldn't lose anyone.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: You're absolutely right.  You forgot to mention their nuclear subs.  But it wouldn't matter. Sure we wouldn't get off without getting our hair mussed but we'd prevail.  I don't think we'd lose more than fifty million people tops.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: But even then we wouldn't get everything.  I mean some missiles would abort or they'd miss their targets or maybe the enemy have some secret bases we don't know about.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I know so Major.  I know so.  And add to that the whole Air Command force being committed to clobber everything they've got.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I guess so.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Our missiles would impact before my planes were even discovered by the enemy wouldn't they?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I suppose we might catch them off their guard.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: You're being dense Major.  I certainly don't

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: But then why do you want to kill a hundred and sixty million of our people sir?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: That's close enough Major.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well I think I remember reading the report on that.  Wasn't it something like a hundred and sixty million?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: If we haven't taken any further action they certainly will.  Doyyourhappen to remember the statistics on our casualties in the event of a full-scale enemy attack?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: But when they do sir won't they hit back with everything they've got?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: You see Major at this very moment while we sit and chat a decision is being made by the President in the War Room.  He knows that the enemy will pick up our planes on their radar in about twenty minutes.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I'm trying to sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: When he said it fifty years ago he might have been right.  But today war is too important to be left to the politicians. Do you follow me Major?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I see.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: He said war was too important a matter to be left to Generals.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I don't think so sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Do you remember what Clemenceau once said about war?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: No sir.  I mean I didn't think you hadn't given it a lot of thought.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I've given it alot of thought Major.  Don't think I haven't.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well General -- I was wondering why are you doing this?  I mean why do you want to start the war?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Ask away Major.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: General Ripper can I ask another question?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: To peace on earth.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: What shall we drink to sir?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Perfect.  Thank you Major.  And now let's drink a toast.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: That about right?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Just a squirt.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: How much soda sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: You're damned right they are.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I suppose they are sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: We've come a long way since World War II Major.  And the lessons we've learned are all in Plan-R.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I know that sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Don't fret about it Major.  There's nothing anyone can do about it now.  I'm the only one who knows the three-letter code group for the CRM-114.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Perhaps Major.  Perhaps.  Pour me a scotch and soda please.  And help yourself to whatever you like.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: But -- why...that would be an awful thing to do sir.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Suppose that were the case?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Because I thought it proper Major.  Why else would you think I'd do it?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: But then sir why have you issued the order: Wing attack Plan-R?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: And if that were true?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well I was thinking maybe an enemy attack is not in progress?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: That's a good question Major.  Maybe if you think hard you can think of the answer yourself.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well sir I was thinking if an enemy attack is in progress how come the radio's still playing music?  It's supposed to go off and all we should hear are Civil Defense broadcasts.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: You know the regulations well Major.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: And a condition red means enemy attack in progress doesn't it?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: That is correct Major.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well General Ripper sir -- I was thinking -- we're on a condition red aren't we?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Certainly Major Mandrake.  You're a good officer and you can ask me a question any time you want to.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yes sir.  General can I ask a question?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I didn't mean for anyone to play anyone else's radio either Major.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Oh it's not my radio sir.  I picked it up in the communications center.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I see you're playing your radio Major. Isn't that contrary to my instructions for the personnel of this base?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: That's right Major.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Sort of like a new hobby huh General?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Please don't take any notice of this weapon Major.  I love all weapons and as of late I've just taken to keeping a loaded weapon nearby at all times.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: What's the gun for General Ripper?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: You've lied to me twice - I'm sorry but it will be strictly routine.  These men are experts.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: General stick to the point please.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Is there any chance a single aircraft can penetrate the entire enemy Air Defense when its course and target are known?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: What's the target.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Have you tried the recall again?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yes?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: How do you know they were shot down Buck?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Hello are you still there?...Uh-huh...I'll be right back.  We're still working this thing out.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Look he's there and you're here.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: He says they've only shot down three planes.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: General Schmuck are you positive of your figures?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: General Faceman what was the name of the officer who called me from Burpelson?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: How many planes did we lose?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: How long will it take to receive them all?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Have you received acknowledgements from every plane?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Knock it off will you General?  Crudley find out what's holding up that call!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: That's the idea General Schmuck.  Zlat!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Admiral Buldike?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I want to talk to General Ripper.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Then there's no chance for recall?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: How could you let this happen General Schmuck?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: How soon until the enemy finds out what's going on?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: And I suppose you're going to tell me you don't know what the three-letter code is.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Why can't you cancel it?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: What the hell is Plan-R?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: And I suppose there's some reason why you haven't recalled them?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well what about the Positive Control the safety catch?  Don't the planes automatically come back unless they get a second order?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I presume the planes are armed?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Can't help it.  What's the wind like?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Give me revs for maximum speed at sea level.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: All right...we're still flying.  I'm taking her down to the deck.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Thanks Binky.  Can you see Bromdingna Island yet?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Lothar take your checks now.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Roger. One-three-eight.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Give me a first rough course as soon as you can Lieutenant Ballmuff.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: No they wouldn't send us in with bombs on an exercise.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Maximum ECM.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: He's right.  They must have clobbered some of our cities already.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: He's right.  We wouldn't have started it.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: What else could it be?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Sure I'll take her up right now.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Sure I'll take her up to eight hundred.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Hey Terry I'm hit.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Hang on boys.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: If they come down low enough to make a firing pass they'll never be able to pull up in time.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: They can't touch us at this height.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: They must have made a visual contact.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Roger.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Lieutenant Quiffer we're all sorry you were hit and we'll help you stick it together as soon as we get squared away.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Come on Quentin isn't that pretty selfish putting yourself ahead of the mission?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Lieutenant Toejam why don't you help him?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: We'll worry about that later.  Okay I'll take damage reports.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Maximum ECM!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Call them every five miles.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Speed?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: They must have been fired from Bromdingna - probably one of their new Vampire - 202's. They've got a range well over a hundred miles.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Roger keep calling them.  Knock off auto-pilot Ace.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Check.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Check.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: A through H is correct.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Forget it Quentin.  It can happen to the best of us.  Now let's get squared away.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: War.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Then this is it.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Skip it and jump damn you!  This flak's so close I can smell it.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Forget it.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Very interesting.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: No kidding.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: What does it look like?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Damn you Lieutenant Toejam!  Lothar!

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Listen I think I'm hit bad.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Lieutenant Toejam's going to help you in a minute.  Can you check your ECM?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Primary arming switch.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Lieutenant Toejam are you ready for Bim and Bam?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Primary target the ICBM base at Laputa. One weapon fused for air burst at ten thou- sand.  Second weapon to be used if first malfunctions.  Otherwise the secondary gets it - the airfield outside of Karnak.  Fused air burst at ten thousand.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Okay.  Check these points.  Complete radio silence.  To ensure that the enemy can't plant false transmissions and fake orders the CRM-114 is to be switched into all receiver circuits.  The three code letters of the period are to be set on the alphabet dials of the CRM-114 which will in turn block any transmissions other than those preceded by the code letters. You got it?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: No this looks like the real thing.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Check your code again.  No one at base would pull a stunt like that Terry.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Yeah?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well I just wanted you to know how I felt. Hell I know Air Command wouldn't have taken you if you weren't okay.  And don't think I don't know some of our best ball-players and entertainers are of Negro descent.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Sure King.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I just wanted you to know I didn't mean anything by it.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Forget it.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Listen Lothar.  You know that crack I made about your...butt?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Thanks King.  I've always wanted to take one of these big babies in.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I'd be mighty proud if you did Lothar.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: King would you mind if I keep me hands on the wheel when you take her in?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I thought maybe you'd like some company.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Now what the hell did you want to go and do a thing like that for Lothar?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I thought I'd go along for the ride.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: What the hell are you doing here Lothar?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: We're on course Major.  Just fixed our position on that river back there.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Roger.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Well it would probably help if you took it ...sort of...straight down.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Would it matter if they hit at a flat angle? I mean do you think the deuterium mass might separate from the atomic trigger?

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: I think it's okay King.  They should go off on impact.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: There's no other way boys.  I'm going to have to take her in...the hard way.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb
text: Let me check.

movieTitle: dr. strangelove or: how i learned to stop worrying and love the bomb

I did. I split man. I expanded my horizons you know. Served my country. Saw the world you know? I've gained wisdom and now I'm back baby back from the road. Me and Jack Kerouac.
Ha! Thank you! See? He did it. He left.
Seriously? It's a great idea.
At least I have a point of view you know?
Yes that's right. You know what honey? You should go to New York. You should go. Go show 'em. They need your unique point of view.
Fuck.
The fuck not?
I'm going out later.
Right back to California.  We've got to go home and rest up from our vacation.
Sorry.  Don't know a thing.
No.
I never tried to kid you reporters -- I'm telling you the truth.
Sorry.  I don't know anything about it.
He's just around the corner.
I can't find him.  I've tried everything.  I thought you might know.
Just a minute...
He's never forgotten a promise to me.  I'm worried about him.  I know something's happened to him.
But tonight is Christmas Eve!
It's all right.
I'm sorry.
Wel-l-l it seems he has a secretary.
Look -- those are the first metals that came through.
You better take a drink.
What?
Said he stole his invention.
Don't start worrying about him. He's a good guy but screwy.
Help yourself.  Oh Tom show this gentleman...
And if it isn't?
Well!
Another young man.
Oh Andy Andy!
Why not?
This is a pretty dead bunch isn't it?
Go away!
Why not? I am crazy....the whole family's crazy.

How would you like to have a couple of little murderers for your children?  It'd be fun wouldn't it?  Maybe they'd murder each other...  keep it all in the family. That's what Father should have done.  He should have killed me and Gilbert... then we wouldn't have had this to go through.
I can't marry you!  I can't ever marry you!
You don't understand.  You don't know what's going to happen.
Please!  You can't get mixed up in this.
And don't ever try to see me again.
You're sweet but the only thing that you can do for me is to go.
I can't.
I can't help it.  You don't know.....
Oh Andy.
And I'll give then proof!
Mother!
Now do you believe me!
Oh!
There!
I don't believe it! You're lying!
I don't think you will.  It's your father's.
All right then.  I'll tell them.
I'll do nothing of the sort.
You hand that over to the police.
It's a piece of evidence that's worth a great deal more than that.
Then what are you hiding?
I didn't.
You took that money from Julia's hand.
Nonsense! She got at she deserved.
Don't.  It's horrible.
Shush!
Did it ever occur to you that Chris might work?
I didn't say I would.  But we've got to have money.
Mother ....  you couldn't do that. You couldn't go to her.
I won't have you hounding him any more for money.
That's gone long ago.  I've got to see him.  Where is he?
You just want money -- and you haven't any right to any more.  He made a big settlement on you.
No.
He's all right.  Isn't that enough?
That isn't true.  It was about your father.  Where is he?
Nothing.
What is it?
Do you know where he's living?  Oh....  Well at least I'm glad he's all right.  Thank you for calling. Goodbye.
What is it? Has he found him?
Oh here she is.
Give it to me.
How are you?....  Oh I'm Mrs. Jorgensen now....  No she isn't here.  Is it about her father?  Well can I take the message?
He didn't do it -- Nick!
He wouldn't say.
He's waiting for you.
Thanks...  we're taking your cab.
He's been dead for three months.
Dead?
Hello Nick!  And a party - celebrating father's third murder -
Hello Dorothy.
That's the truth.
Don't lie to me.
I bought it in a pawn shop.
Where did you get this gun?
Oh yeah?  People fall toward a shot you know...  not back from it.  I knew you were lying.
She... she fell over backwards.
Which way did she fall?
I don't know.
Did she make any sound?  Didn't scream?
She fell down.
Pretty good shot you are. What did she do?
Why... in the heart.
Where did you hit her?
Yes.  I hated her for coming between my mother and father.  She kept me from seeing my father.  I went down there to ask her where he was.  She wouldn't tell me and I shot her.
What are you trying to tell me? That you did it?
There.
Yes.
You heard about Julia Wolf?
I've got to see you alone!
Come on in.
Oh thank heaven.
I just wanted to relieve your mind. Your father's alive and all right.
Thanks.  We will.  Goodbye.
We're at the Normandie for a couple of weeks.  Why don't you drop around?
How do you do?  I'm sorry we have to rush.
No.  The lawyer -- I'm going to see him.
Your father?
Why don't you try him again?
tried him once -
That's it...  Herbert Macaulay.
Macaulay.

Disappeared!
That's what I was going to ask you.  he's disappeared!
Yes.  Some nut who wanted to kill him.  How is your father?
Andy...  this is Nick Charles.  He worked on a case for father.
Probably not.
was fascinated with you....  a real live detective....  You used to tell me the most wonderful stories.  Were they true?
How did you ever remember me?
Yes.
Not that scrawny little....?

Yes.
Aren't you Nick Charles?
Of course we do! We've been friends for years.
You know we know each other.
Hello there!
Another Martini --
Goodbye my boy.  Take care of Dorothy.  Show her that there is such a thing as a happy marriage.
Goodbye darling.  Don't you dare forget...  December 30th.
Better get home before it is.
But it isn't bad weather now.
Only in bad weather.
Poor Dad does that still bother you?
He's a brave man.
And he still wants to marry me!
Like all the rest of us.  Has this fellow...  ...has he seen the whole family?
You're not missing much.  He's cuckoo.
I know -- I know --
You know how it is Dad.  He's sort of under Mother's thumb.
I'd like to see him.  Why don't you bring him down?
He's all right.
How's your brother?
That's one thing I won't forget.  Where's Macaulay?  I ought to be starting.
It's a promise?

We were planning to be married right after Christmas.
Yes.  And I don't want anybody to steal it from me.
A new invention?
It's a secret.  I can't even tell you my dear.  I've got an important idea to work on.
Where are you going?
Wait a minute.  When is it going to be? I'm leaving town tonight.
If you think it'll be all right.
He can stay home.  Please Dad won't you?
Wouldn't it be a little embarrassing ...  all of us there ...  your other and me and your stepfather?
This is my wedding.
What would your mother say to that?
I hate all that fuss.  But I'll do it on one condition -- that you're there to give me away.
Yes she would.
Mother's set her heart on a big church wedding.
Dad this is what I really wanted to ask you....
You see how much we have to say.
He'll still be your son-in-law!
Take a good look at him Dad.  Now please try to remember him... 'cause he's going to be your son- in-law.
Forgive me.  How are you?
It's been the same one for three months.
Yes... yes.
Shrapnel!

Do you mind if I come down and see it?
Going to run him through the fluoroscope?

I hope you won't talk that way to the police when they come here.
Gilbert!
Not a thing.
That woman!

You see he'd been very clever. Everybody even our astute friend Guild thought that Wynant was alive and that he was the murderer. But our hero had just one weak link in his chain.  The telegrams wires and telephones were all very well - but no one had seen Wynant. So he picked on poor Mimi here to strengthen his case.  Mimi is the only one at the table who can tell us who the real murderer is.  Mimi who was it that told you to say you'd seen Wynant?
Shut up.
--was Wynant's.
You mean that body-----?
Because I found out for certain that he didn't commit the murders.
Why didn't you tell me? .... Why didn't you hold him?
No.
Are you kidding?
I'll take care of him.
What're you doing here?
Just the same Wynant wouldn't mind having him out of the way would he?  How long should you say this body'd been here Doc?
Yes.  But we figured it was just blackmail...
He said Wynant tried to steal an invention.
I never saw him.  I don't think anyone saw him.
Could this be him?
Rosebreen.
Extraordinarily lucky.
Lucky thing for us they weren't in that lime.
Just rolled them up and threw them in.
This is enough for me.
Fifty will still get you a hundred.
I guess that cinches it eh Mr. Charles?  He killed them both - Julia Wolf and Nunheim.

Get anything?
Nunheim!
Trail him!  Trail who?

Who're you calling?
I think we're on the right track.
Well what'd you think?
Let's go and see.  Taxi!
He's holding out on you.

I'll check on that.  I'm afraid this is kinder dull for you.

They're all O.K.  Mrs. Jorgensen the boy Dorothy Macaulay... even Morelli... we had to let him go.

Who's your candidate?
For one thing he was too absent- minded to hold a grudge.

No proof?

Yeah. Couldn't find a thing. This is the way we figure it.  Wynant goes to Julia's apartment. He finds Morelli there... sees she's two- timing him.  They have a fight. But he figures he don't want to do anything then.... Morelli might squeal.  So he goes away. He don't let his lawyer know anything has happened... he lets him go ahead and and hand over money to Julia to give to him so that Julia will think it's all blown over. Then when she don't expect it... he lets her have it.
You've been there?
I thought it might be.  From now on they're going to think that every thin man over six feet with white hair is Wynant.
Oh that's a phoney.  The men didn't even have to go down.
What about the suicide?
It's a bargain then.  Anything you want to know?
So would I.
Man to man I'm not.
Man to man Mr. Charles are you working on this case?
That ain't a gun any more.  The firing pin's busted - the -  Don't waste time talking about that.
You mean about that gun?
You oughtn't to play this trick on me.  Running out when I was giving you time to rest up before I asked you those questions.
Okay.  There's plenty of time. I guess we got to ask you a lot more questions than we counted on. We'll come up tomorrow when you're feeling better.  Come on.
I'll have to try to remember.

No.
This gun yours?

Keep on asking.
I'm asking you.
Ask him.  I don't know.

What's that to you?
Wanted to tell me he didn't kill Julia Wolf.
What's he want of you?
I never saw him before.
We were looking for this bird.
Yes.  I might not have been shot.

We hear this is getting to be sort of a meeting place for the Wynant family so we figure we'll stick around in case the old man himself shows up.  Then we seen him...  ...sneak in and we decide to come up.  And pretty lucky for you.
How'd you people happen to pop in?

Did you go?
When was that?
He did!
Well what?

When was the last time you gave her money for Wynant?
Let him have his say out.
That's ridiculous.
Tell 'em.
A brown suit brown shoes and a white shirt and a grayish tie with red or reddish brown figures on it.
What kind of clothes was he wearing?
That's nothing.  I saw him myself.
You did!
Goodbye.
Goodbye.
That's all right.  Well we'll be going.
The Medical Examiner seems to think that the body was touched.  He says it looks as if the girl's hand had been forced open after she was killed....
I don't think so.  Of course I was terribly upset...  I hardly knew what I was doing.
Are you sure you didn't leave the room...  that one of the bellhops or maids might not have been in there alone?
No.
Did you see anything in Miss Wolfe's hand?
Why yes.
You say you were in the room with the body from the time you discovered it 'til we came?

Do you think that Wynant did it?

But he's interested!
Good morning Lieutenant -  Sorry.
Good morning --

Where were you?
Where were you?

Want to take a poke at him?
Maybe if you quit running around after other women you wouldn't have so much trouble with this one.
What's the idea of telling me you just knew the Wolfe girl by sight?
Why you said...
and there she was lying dead.  The police said she'd probably been killed about ten minutes before I got there.
Chris -- Chris -- !

What are you going to do?
I couldn't go near that woman.
Chris!
I know.
I'll get some.

You're going to return every cent of it!
Hello ....  give me ....  Well ....  ?

I want that money right now or I'll hand you over to the police.
That's my business.

Now see here Julia.  You're counting a little too much on my being absent-minded.  You've been taking a little here and there for some time and I haven't said anything about it.  But this is fifty thousand dollars!

Oh he as clever about that.  He called when you were out.  That same afternoon Julia telephoned to him. She said that you were coming Mimi to ask about Wynant. He got terrified. He was afraid that Julia would break down and tell... so he went to Julia and killed her and left Wynant's watch chain in her hand.

It wouldn't hurt to put it in.
It might.
Slim.
That's all right.
How are you?
S'long.
My wife.
No word at all?

My wife's father died and left her a lumber mill and a narrow guage railroad and a couple of other things.  And I'm looking after them.
I haven't been a detective for four years.
Mimi?  ...  Oh Dorothy's mother.  Does she have to be up to something?
That's all right.  What are you drinking?

I'm lot going to stay here to be insulted -
You're lying Mimi.  But then you'd do anything for money.  You're getting a good price for saying you saw Wynant and you figure you won't get anything if he's dead.
It isn't a story - it's true.  I did see Wynant.  He's not dead.

And the murderer is right here in this room tonight... he's sitting at this table.  You may serve the fish.
Perfectly absurd.
So I did.  I saw him lying buried in his shop.
Because I don't believe that Clyde's dead!  Why you said yourself you saw him last night.

Last night.  He came to see me at my apartment.
You did... where?
I've got some very important news - I've seen Wynant.
This is all very pleasant but why are here?
All right then -- I'll tell them who did do it!
They'll want more than your word for that.
I tell you -- he didn't do it.
That's not for you to decide. Everybody's under suspicion - especially running off like this --  The police will want his description.  Is this a picture of him?
But he has nothing to do with it!
You should have told them he'd disappeared.

Gilbert!  Is he here too?  We might as well be living in the lobby.
Where's Gilbert?
Yes...
Dorothy!  Is she here?
I tell you again I don't want any part of it.  Now you take Dorothy home and...

Well don't you?
Oh I know he didn't but I wish I could find him...  I have something very important to tell him. Macaulay won't help at all.  He thinks I just want money.
What do you think?
Clyde Wynant's crazy... absolutely crazy to stay away at a time like this. No wonder the police think he has something to do with it.
want to talk to you about something very important.
Hello Mimi.
Oh Nick... Nick!
I hope you won't let this news spoil your dinner.  Nice food isn't it?

Thank you.  Now I'll tell you why I know Wynant didn't commit those murders -  Three months ago - the night that he caught you in Julia's apartment he found out that Julia was cheating him and was splitting with some man.  He went to find the man. That man was.... Tanner don't you...?
Why do you say that?
Morelli -  You knew Julia.  Was she gypping Wynant?
This is your party.
I am on the level. If I knew anything I'd....
I'd tell you if I knew. But I'm not in this.  Ask the police.
How is Studsy?  I didn't know he was out of stir.
That's all swell.  Only you're peddling your fish in the wrong market. I've got nothing to do with it.
Why tell me?
All right - you didn't.
I've never heard about you.
Do you mind putting that gun away? My wife doesn't care but I'm in a delicate condition.

His plan was still working beautifully. Wynant was established as being in town.  The watch chain was handed over....  ...with a slight delay...to the police. The only hitch was a man named Nunheim who had found out something.  Our hero paid Nunheim once to keep his mouth shut and when Nunheim threatened him again he bumped him off.
I hope you're well.
It's the only way it makes sense.
Why are you saying it?
I don't know.
Is that true?

After our hero had killed Wynant he got a brilliant idea.  He realized that he and Julia could still collect money.  Wynant was supposed to be on a trip - no one knew where - so our dinner guest wrote letters to Macaulay signing Wynant's name so that Macaulay would continue to send the money to Julia.  He even telephoned Macaulay --  Do you remember?.... the first day that you came to see me... he telephoned that he was in town?
If that knife is missing I'll look for it in your back.

Let's see... where was I?  Oh yes.  He went to find the man. That man was desperate!  He knew that he was caught dead to rights -- and with prison staring him in the face he took the only way out. He killed Wynant.  It's terrible to tell you this way but your father's dead Dorothy.
You're going to drive me crazy!
I'm afraid you're lying Mimi. You see I really did see Wynant last night.
Serve the nuts - I mean serve the guests the nuts.
I wish you'd tell me.
I wish you'd tell me who.
Yes.
I can't wait any longer.  Tell me do you think one of them did it?
Thank you Mrs. Charles.
You give such charming parties Mr. Charles.
Mimi Jorgensen Morelli Tanner.....
Mimi!
Mimi...
Who do you think did it?
Oh they'll come.  I'll have Guild issue the invitations.
The suspects!  They won't come.
I'm going to give a party and invite all of the suspects.
I've got a lulu -- why?
Got a nice evening dress?
Now Nick what's that got to do with it?
Got a nice evening dress?
Yes!
I'm going to get the real murderer. I've got an idea.  Want to see me take him?
What are you going to do?
I want to lie low till I get the whole dope.  I don't want to go off half-cocked.
Why not?
I can't help it. I can't tell a soul.  I didn't even tell Guild.
But the poor kid's going crazy. She'd rather know her father was dead than that...
Hey... hey.  Don't do that.
I'm going to tell her.
No.  Nobody but you.
Wynant dead?  Does Dorothy know?
Smart gal.
Then he couldn't have committed those other murders.
Couple of months anyway.
How long has he been dead?
I remembered that Wynant had some shrapnel in his shin.  It often bothered him.  So I looked for it and I found it.  Gimme.
You don't get another swallow 'til you really open up.
Sure.
Well don't they?
Oh.  Well the clothes for instance. They were carefully preserved and the body was just as carefully destroyed.  The person who killed him counted on one thing... that all skeletons look alike.
What things made you so sure?
Huh?
Nick you'll drive me crazy.  What things?
Several things.  Hello Fred.  We're hungry again. Yeah and lots of onions.  Oh and coffee.
What makes you so sure it's Wynant's body?

That's what they think... Guild and all of them.  They take it for granted that it's just another of Wynant's victims.  Guild's hot-footing it around now looking for Wynant. That's all that troubles him.
But they all said it was Rosebreen's.
Yup.  Don't you want something to eat?
Wynant's body?
That's a fact.
Nick you'd better lay off that liquor.
It was his body that was buried there.
Nick!
He was down in the shop.
What do you mean?
I did find him!
I want you to stay and find Wynant.
My soul woman.  I give you three murders and you aren't satisfied.
Back to California
I don't care - I'm just used to you that's all --  If you let anything happen to him you'll never wag that tail again!
Why I believe the little woman cares.
Don't say it that way. Say it as if you meant it.
Sure I will.
Nickie take care of yourself won't you?
Goodbye darling.
You dog!
Not with all your money!
You bet I wouldn't.
You wouldn't be a widow long.
Go on - go on - see if I care. But it's a dirty trick bringing me all the way to New York just to make me a widow.
I'll be all right.  I've got Asta to protect me.
I know but this is different. He's a crazy man. He might kill you.
Say you're the one who got me in this!
Nick - I won't have you going down there.
I don't know...  This thing has got my goat. I've got to find out.
You mean he might be hiding there?
He went away lots of times when I knew him - but he never closed his shop. I've got a hunch something is up.
Why shouldn't be close it? He went away.
I've got hunch.  I'm going down to look at Wynant's shop I want to find out why it's closed.
What are you going to do?
Looks like a hold-up!
What's that?  What are you up to?  Nickie - what is this?
We're going sightseeing -- aren't we Asta?
He's just been for a walk.
I'm going to take Asta for a walk.
I wish they'd stop that.  It makes me fidgety. Do you think they'll find him Nick?  He must be in New York....  Where do you think you're going?
Catch me letting you go alone!
This may be a little rough - you'd better let us go alone.
Come on Watson we're going places.
So am I.
No reason.  Just a hunch.  But I'm going to find out.  I'm tired of being pushed around.
Why don't you?
I don't believe he did it.
But Wynant --- ?
Maybe I will.
The mystery's all gone. And I wanted you to find out who did it.
What's the matter with you?
What's the trouble Asta?  Your balloon busted?  So's mine.
All right hard guy.  Get up and bleed on the rugs.
You talk as if I were Asta.
Sit down!
It's not going to hurt me to get up.
Well that's that.  Stay there Nick!
Yes.  It's Asta's Christmas present.
Oh it's a fire hydrant.
Oh take it!  Please take it!
Your guess is as good as mine.
He wouldn't ask you to handle it if he were guilty.
I don't know.
Philadelphia.  Then he didn't do it did he Nick?
Let's see.  Where's it from?
Yes.
Did I give it to you?
Yes.
Is that another Christmas present?
I'm stifling but it's so pretty.  The Kirbys.
Aren't you hot in that?
Macaulay.
Who's that?
Hello... send him up.
That's not true.  He never came near my tabloids.  That's one thing I always protect... my tabloids.
I read you were shot five times in the tabloids.
Yes.  I know all they know about the murder. And I'm a great hero. The Tribune said I was shot twice.
Finished with these?
You must admit I have good taste.
You did.
Who gave it to you?
No.  It's a Christmas present.
I never saw that before.
Well didn't you?
On it!  I'm in it ... They think I did it!
He's got more sense than you have. Thank Heaven you're not on this case.
You're a fine watch dog.
He'll be here.  Give him time to get his trousers on.  Where's Asta?  Asta!  Asta!
I wish that doctor'd come.  How do you feel?
Yeah.
Want a drink?
I'll be all right. Don't let's fuss till the doctor comes.
